text: #Fungible..a word we use all the time in South Armagh! According to @tconnellyRTE T/May’s deputy PM David Lidington told EU @theresa_may Brexit extension could be ‘fungible’ - subject to events at Westminster - id est if Treaty was passed she could go short or otherwise go long!
author: EamonnMallie

text: #TheLady. Dropping my car in for valeting I set about explaining to the young Romanian how exactly I wanted it done. “No problem” he protested “I clean the lady,” “but” I said, “No problem. I clean the lady,” he added. He was referring to my lady wife whose car he also cleans.
author: EamonnMallie

text:
‘No chance’ of US deal if Brexit leads to hard border
via @IrishTimes
author: EamonnMallie

text: #Brexit #DUP..For @NigelDoddsDUP & his @duponline colleagues the Union overrides every other concern. To them this is their ‘parity of esteem’ or political & economic integrity with the rest of the UK. That could mean in reality on the ground here ‘live horse & you’ll get grass.’
author: EamonnMallie

text: Unfortunately not. E.
author: EamonnMallie

text: #Brexit.. “Dup says No.” @theresa_may @duponline
author: EamonnMallie

text: #Indicative Votes.. @vincecable  now confirming (what @skynews claimed earlier) on emerging from the Cabinet office that the government is now discussing the notion of MPs being offered an opportunity to vote on up to 7 indicative scenarios including a revocation of Article 50.
author: EamonnMallie

text:
#Miami Show Band .. ‘The Day the Music Died’ a painting by Belfast artist Jack Pakenham in response to the Miami Show Band killings on the Belfast Dundalk road in 1975. Netflix documentary: 

“ReMastered – The Miami Showband Massacre" airing this Month.
author: EamonnMallie

text: Birmingham pub bombings: 'Men responsible' named by IRA bomber - BBC News
author: EamonnMallie

text: #Brexit..@SkyNews reporting that Downing Street is considering a series of indicative votes - as many as seven options to try and establish what is purchasable by MPs.
author: EamonnMallie

text: ‘Caterwauling’ from my new collection ‘Under the Tilley Lamp.’
author: EamonnMallie

text:
The DUP's Westminster adventure is coming to an end
via @IrishTimes
author: EamonnMallie

text: #Hope.. That Pope is everywhere ... ‘Hope springs eternal.’
author: EamonnMallie

text: #Brexit..talk now of ‘revocation’ of Article 50. There is something very ‘Vatican’ about that word!
author: EamonnMallie

text: Mark, if the EU remains constant on the backstop is it conceivable the DUP would violate this red line which states: ‘We will not accept any form of regulatory divergence which separates Northern Ireland economically or politically from the rest of the United Kingdom.”
author: EamonnMallie

text:
#’Walking in your Neighbour’s shoes. The late Cardinal O’ Fiaich explaining his opposition to IRA violence told me: 
“ If you live under my roof and you get drunk every weekend & break my windows, you will not be at the Christmas party.”
author: EamonnMallie

text: #FirstButterFly: I spotted my first butterfly today. My heart fluttered: then it had gone: Why did it go! I'll never know. Its up and go was a cruel blow.
author: EamonnMallie

text:
#Brexit.....”In Ireland there is no future, only the happening over and over.”
Leon Uris.
author: EamonnMallie

text: Peter Taylor’s top 10 books on the Troubles | Books | The Guardian
author: EamonnMallie

text: #BorderPoll .. @sinnfeinireland gratuitous calls by SInn Féin for a Border Poll clearly unsettle Unionist neighbours in Northern Ireland. Any change in NI’s constitutional status ought to be organic in line with the consent principle outlined in the Good Friday Agreement.
author: EamonnMallie

text: #DUP#Brexit .. does the @duponline realise remarks by its leader & some of its elected members have turned nationalists off the notion of entertaining a power-sharing government? Downing Street has got this message but it’s not on its radar right now.
author: EamonnMallie

text: #language of the People.. down home we spoke of ‘talking ‘90’ to the dozen.’ Factually it should be 19 to the dozen: Origin: in 18thC Cornish tin and copper mines a pump cleared 19000 gallons of water for every 12 bushels of coal. Hence 19 to the Dozen!
author: EamonnMallie

text:
“So I governed my tongue
In front of her, a genuinely well-
Adjusted adequate betrayal
Of what I knew better. I'd naw and aye
And decently relapse into the wrong
Grammar which kept us allied and at bay.” Touché Seamus. Portrait by @colin_davidson
author: EamonnMallie

text: #DUP..The DUP argues any ‘backstop’ is a challenge to NI’s political & economic integrity, a threat to Unionist ‘parity of esteem’ with the rest of the UK. Is there a silver lining? Will this help the DUP to understand ‘parity of esteem?’ from a nationalist perspective?
author: EamonnMallie

text: #Violence..In the unsettled world in which we live is it not long after time to end all the glorification and deification in word & song of those who used pararmilitary or state violence for political reasons? Are we not poisoning the next generation?
author: EamonnMallie

text:
#Brexit .. @duponline spent years ‘hollowing out’ cross-border bodies, exploiting a ‘Petition of Concern’ (a cross-community veto intended to prevent discrimination) to block LGBT, same sex marriage & ‘parity of esteem’ for nationalists. 
What will be the ultimate price?
author: EamonnMallie

text: #Brexit If @duponline refuses to budge on its contention that EU/UK ‘backstop’ post Brexit threatens the Union, despite CBI, UFU, warnings of potential NI job losses, will DUP’s core voters remain faithful? Does DUP leadership realise its behaviour may have killed devolution?
author: EamonnMallie

text: #Leadership .. are we witnessing at leadership level in today’s @sinnfeinireland what we saw in @SDLPlive with the end of the Hume/Mallon era - a diminished SDLP? The Adams/McGuinness era is now history. Current SF leadership making some bad judgement calls.
author: EamonnMallie

text: #RugbySchoolsCup.. my first try .. @DBSchoolsCup @MethodyBelfast v @CampbellCollege sponsored by @DanskeBank_UK .
author: EamonnMallie

text: #Brexit and People...I have crossed swords with David Starkey on my professional travels...but his exposition on how our self-satisfied politicians have launched a coup over Brexit is interesting.
author: EamonnMallie

text: #Golf .. Lá Fhéile Pádraig agus Lá Fhéile Rory! Ar fheabhas ... St Patrick’s Day and Rory’s Day.
author: EamonnMallie

text:
#DUP.. is it conceivable that ⁦@duponline⁩ would as the old people used to say ‘live horse and you’ll get grass?’ 

⁦@Peston⁩ ⁦@tconnellyRTE⁩

What the PM offered the DUP - ITV News
author: EamonnMallie

text:
Where lambs have nibbled, silent moves
  The feet of angels bright;
    Unseen, they pour blessing,
    And joy without ceasing,
    On each bud and blossom,
    And each sleeping bosom.
author: EamonnMallie

text:
#Poetry..I always come back to my God among poets. 

March 

by Patrick KAVANAGH.
author: EamonnMallie

text:
#Poetry...another big apple American poet William Stanley Merwin falls from the tree of knowledge. 

Separation

Your absence has gone through me 
Like thread through a needle. 
Everything I do is stitched with its color.
author: EamonnMallie

text: What the PM offered the DUP - ITV News https://www.itv.com/news/2019-03-17/what-the-pm-offered-the-dup/ …

text: The public is losing patience: MPs must vote for May’s Brexit deal
author: EamonnMallie

text: There is a completeness about this word. No frills•
author: EamonnMallie

text: #Clonard .. priest @ClonardMBelfast referencing stone sculpture of St Patrick, bearing of a lamb on his shoulders - suggests, this action could symbolise a wounded lamb or a wounded church.
author: EamonnMallie

text:
#Brexit...a powerful read Tony.. but where are we now with no bell on our bike? 

How backstop deal was done and why Cox blew it apart
author: EamonnMallie

text: No Trevor.
author: EamonnMallie

text: #Queen.. does anyone know where the Queen saw her first ‘motion picture?’ Portrait of Queen by @colin_davidson
author: EamonnMallie

text: @RTELateLateShow .. #Ryan Tubridy .. an excellent show tonight.. and no one has mentioned #Brexit yet.
author: EamonnMallie

text: #Brexit when the stance on Brexit taken by @duponline and @Jacob_Rees_Mogg et al. is put under the microscope it is nothing more than uber English nationalism. Reminds me of the line ‘for the love of one’s country is a terrible thing & it makes us all part of the patriot game.’
author: EamonnMallie
